result.execSummary:
The defendant Kovan Peters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Costs due during term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

timeConds.notes: -Submit DNA at Ozaukee County Sheriff's Dept.

supervisions.notes: Court costs due in full within 6 months of release from jail.   Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

Defendant Kovan Peters in court with attorney Nolan A. Jensen.  Defendant in custody. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant Kovan Peters appears by video from Ozaukee County Jail with Attorney Heather Dvoran.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant qualifies for public defender. Counsel waives reading of complaint. State requests $5000 cash bail with conditions continuing from previous bond. Counsel requests $500 cash bail; defendant missed court because he didn't have a ride and defendant was in bad financial state at the time. Defendant is now more financially stable. Court sets bail.  Further proceedings scheduled for October 3, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kovan Peters in court with attorney Sergio Magana.  Jeffrey Alan Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court finds probable cause and orders matter bound over for arraignment. Information filed.   Information read, defendant advised of penalties, further reading waived. Plea of not guilty entered. State by ADA Jeffrey Sisley.  Defendant in custody & appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty Dejunco.  Counsel advises the defendant does qualify for public defender representation and counsel will be appointed.  Counsel waives reading.  Counsel advises the defendant was not aware of a court date.  State advises the summons and complaint was not returned, requesting $500 cash bail w/conditions.  Court orders $500 cash bail w/condition:  no contact with Walmart in Saukville.  Counsel requesting status of prelim.  Court orders matter adj to 3/3 at 8:30 am for status of prelim hearing in B2.  Court finds good cause to extend timelimits for holding of a preliminary hearing.
